name: B. Marin and Anti-coprime Permutation
statement:
Marin wants you to count number of permutations that are . A permutation
of length n is a permutation that has the following property:
gcd (1
cdot p_1,
, 2
cdot p_2,
,
dots,
, n
cdot p_n) > 1, where
gcd is the greatest common divisor.A permutation is an array consisting
of n distinct integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order. For example,
[2,3,1,5,4] is a permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a permutation (2
appears twice in the array) and [1,3, 4] is also not a permutation (n=3
but there is 4 in the array).
